indicators.questionText: Classroom Culture (Teachers create a classroom environment that fosters a climate of urgency and expectations around achievement and excellence and respect) - Check if Observed

answerOptions.optionText: Displays high expectations for students
Recognizes individual efforts
Safe, well-organized learning environment
Open communications is evident between students and teacher
Teacher treats students fairly and consistently
Mutual respect is displayed in the classroom
Maximization of instruction time

indicators.questionText: Purposeful Planning (Teachers use content areas standards to develop a rigorous curriculum relevant for all students; building meaningful units of study, continuous assessment and a system for tracing students progress as well as plans for accommodations and changes in response to a lack of student progress) - Check if Observed

answerOptions.optionText: Student achievement goals are evident
Evidence of knowledge of subject areas
Daily lesson plans.  Lesson plans can be made available to the administration.
Meaningful assignments that engages students, connects activities and assessment to student understanding, and allocates instructionally appropriate time for learning
Effective lesson plans for substitute teachers

indicators.questionText: Effective Instruction (Teacher facilititates student academic practice so that all students are participating and have the opportunity to gain mastery of the objectives) - Check if Observed

answerOptions.optionText: Ties instruction to the objectives and the end results of the lesson
Students understand the purpose of lesson and are actively engaged
Demonstrates effective instructional pacing
Delivers content in a factually correct, well-organized, and challenging manner
Demonstrates a high quality of questioning techniques
Teacher differentiates delivery of instruction based on assessment data
Checks for understanding of content at key moments of lesson
Re-teaches, modifies long-term plans, and modifies practice as appropriate
Uses a variety of instructional strategies to encourage studentsâ€™ development of critical thinking, problem solving and performance skills.
Integrates technology with instruction to maximize student learning and encourage engagement in higher level thinking skills
Provides a variety of grouping patterns when appropriate

indicators.questionText: Assessment (Teacher uses formal and informal assessment strategies to evaluate and ensure the continuous intellectual, social and physical development of learner.) - Check if Observed

answerOptions.optionText: Records student progress data, analyzes student progress toward mastery, and communicates progress to students
Uses information gained from assessments to improve teaching practice and student learning
Provides a variety of assessments
Teaches students to use assessment feedback to guide their own learning

indicators.questionText: Professional Leadership (Teacher develops and sustains the intense energy and leadership within their school community to ensure the achievement of all students) - Check if Observed

answerOptions.optionText: Contributes significant ideas, expertise, and time
Demonstrates a high regard for others, collaborates with colleagues to make the school community successful
Pursues opportunities to  improve knowledge and practices, welcomes constructive feedback to improve practice, actively participates in professional development and the school improvement process
Attempts to remedy obstacles in student achievement to facilitate student success
Strives to develop positive relationships with students and parents, attends conferences and meetings, responds to parents in a timely manner
Remains abreast of current educational research about student learning and/or utilizes innovative resources
